parent.body:
* "Hmmm can you explain why you are feeling that way?" 
* "Maybe that's true in some cases but most women don't think that way!"
* "Not all women *ad infinitum* ......" 
* "What if you looked at it a little differently? People can sense your negativity. You attract what you are putting out. Sometimes a little positivity can go a long way!" 
* " Have you tried talking to women? I know it's hard with everything going on recently, but maybe try those dating apps" 
* " Have you tried joining any clubs, or groups for activities you like? It's the best way to find similar minded people" 

There I just saved you 500$/hour. The point of therapy is to lull you back to sleep with bluepills. Unless you have some specific real traumas to address, there isn't some magic process. You are going to talk, they are going to tell you to look at it in some bluepilled way, or outright deny the reality in favor of a sugar-coated lie. You are just talking to another human being, and likely a female human being who cannot relate to even an iota of your experience.

  • " Have you tried joining any clubs, or groups for activities you like? It's the best way to find similar minded people"

body:
> many couples for instance believe artificial contraception is moral to use.

You can't find a single quote from the bible saying it's not; it didn't even exist in those days.

> Women have not been taught to be submissive to husbands, and husbands not taught how to lead and so on.

This is a false doctrine. I used to believe it and be smug about it. Something still felt "off" as if it didn't line up with everything else, but I didn't think much of it. Besides, it gave me a reason to be "right" and therefore superior to others. The more I did my own study and less just believing what everyone else says, the more obvious it became that this kind of stuff was added by the church fathers to inject Roman culture into Christianity. Which also contrary to what we've been taught, that is very possible.

guild.description:
A place to post and ask about all things Catholic.

News, prayers, memes, architecture, music, culture, everything Catholic is welcome to be posted here.

Some ground rules:

Be governed by a spirit of charity/*caritas* here.  
No bigotry towards the Ordinary or Extraordinary form of worship.
    Trads are most welcome, Novus Ordo devotees are most welcome.  All are considered brothers and sisters in Christ here.
   Civil debate, discussion ok.

SSPX and Sedevacantism will be accepted and discussed if posters/commenters stay civil and act with *caritas*

Trolling will get you exiled.  Go to +DeuxRama for that kind of fun.

Attacks on our Holy Mother Church will meet with instant exile.

Non-Catholics are welcome to browse, post, and comment, provided they stay civil.

Please visit our Traditional *Fratres* at +TraditionalCatholics

*Nota:  Automata non permittunt.*

parent.body:
four issues I have with this:

firstly, a comment on that page says they are surprised to see Francis defend Catholic teaching for once. I am not surprised about this though because my view is Francis only does this to appear Catholic, and then will go back to promoting something that is anti-Catholic. If they were purely one or the other we would know what to expect, but they mix these things together to confuse people.

secondly, he has called for [civil unions for gays](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/pope-francis-endorses-same-sex-civil-unions/) and has been [ambiguous on moral teaching of actions of gays](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/pope-who-am-i-judge-gay-people-flna6C10780741), which is quite a reversed sentiment from the past where such immoral actions were considered so offensive as to have been a capital offense in many countries. If he cares about marriage, he ought ideally to disavow any confusion that might have stemmed from those comments.

thirdly, the state of preparing people for marriage seems to be in strong need of repair - many are not prepared for marriage and end up divorced, or not really following Christian teaching in any general sense - many couples for instance believe artificial contraception is moral to use. Women have not been taught to be submissive to husbands, and husbands not taught how to lead and so on.

fourthly, if "conservatives" really care about marriage, they might work to reform divorce courts, custody arrangements, no fault divorce, and the host of other problems attached to marriages today - without this, the marriage rate in society keeps slipping partially due to these and other unaddressed factors
parent.body_html:
four issues I have with this:

firstly, a comment on that page says they are surprised to see Francis defend Catholic teaching for once. I am not surprised about this though because my view is Francis only does this to appear Catholic, and then will go back to promoting something that is anti-Catholic. If they were purely one or the other we would know what to expect, but they mix these things together to confuse people.

secondly, he has called for civil unions for gays and has been ambiguous on moral teaching of actions of gays, which is quite a reversed sentiment from the past where such immoral actions were considered so offensive as to have been a capital offense in many countries. If he cares about marriage, he ought ideally to disavow any confusion that might have stemmed from those comments.

thirdly, the state of preparing people for marriage seems to be in strong need of repair - many are not prepared for marriage and end up divorced, or not really following Christian teaching in any general sense - many couples for instance believe artificial contraception is moral to use. Women have not been taught to be submissive to husbands, and husbands not taught how to lead and so on.

fourthly, if "conservatives" really care about marriage, they might work to reform divorce courts, custody arrangements, no fault divorce, and the host of other problems attached to marriages today - without this, the marriage rate in society keeps slipping partially due to these and other unaddressed factors

post.meta_description: Pope Francis has urged Christians to pray during the month of June for young men and women preparing for marriage.
post.meta_title: Pope Francis Takes Back June for Man-Woman Marriage

post.body:
A lot of meatheads out there brag about knowing some fighting style and being tough guys, like these in MMA, boxing, etc.

In the real world, it is not worth the effort and waste of time and money training and getting beaten up like this, it is only useful for sports and to show off in front of others.

Look at the policemen or the soldiers in army, although they have some tough training with body contact, obviously, none of them are great fighters, so this shows that war professionals like them don't even waste time on something as ineffective as body contact, and they have been like this since ancient times, because everyone knows that body fighting is for animals, so even big strong men used weapons, be it a club, arrow, knife, sword, machine gun, etc.

The possibility of high and immediate damage makes you think about what you're going to do, and this have a meaning and a purpose, unlike these sport fights which are more like brainless dogs tearing each other apart for stupid motives like money. And this fighting culture also diverts young people from really useful things, like mechanics, agriculture and other things.

And still about this, I have a friend, although he is a few centimeters smaller than me, he is extremely stronger than me, he looks like a neanderthal, in a certain time, he trained so much and lifting weights he had his chest and arms bulging with pure muscle, so, as he could not grow more, and also be equal to other guys at the gym, then he talked to the trainer who explained that to get big like them, it was necessary to take something (steroids), but he did not take, he also knew how to fight boxing, and besides being stronger than me, he is faster than me too. One day, me, him and another friend, were in a car, I was sitting in the back, in front of me was that strong friend in the front seat, and the other one was driving, so I went and put my two hands on the strong guy neck and pulled hard, just for fun, my friend lost all his power and was weaker than a child, the most he could do was put his hands lightly over mine but he had no strength to remove my hands, I think he was losing consciousness, and this was in just less than three or four seconds, and I confess that I'm a weak guy too.

And also this MMA fight video of the idiot and fake ass Dave Bautista, he seems tough too, pure illusion, I remember that at the time of the fight, besides being a shame and cringe for him, there was still talk of it not being valid, since he punched his opponent in the back of the head... Bautista is an idiot who can't even fight, look at his hand movement, he looked scared from the beginning and during the fight.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0zk9B9hFKjA

To me this is proof that these guys who think that are tough guys, they're actually not even worth anything, even if they know how to fight and could kill you with their bare hands. Fighting is garbage and should be banned, it's degeneration stuff for brainless idiots and retards.

body:
Yes, I'm actually male (though I question this and coming off as female to most people on sites dominated almost entirely by males is some evidence).

But more importantly, the fact that you are shocked that I'm not female based on my behavior makes me think you're one of those "oh he/she plays with girls/boys toys, they must be trans!" people. That is no less bigoted than the traditionalists. And yes, progressives can be bigots, and actually are more so on most subjects.
body_html:
Yes, I'm actually male (though I question this and coming off as female to most people on sites dominated almost entirely by males is some evidence).

But more importantly, the fact that you are shocked that I'm not female based on my behavior makes me think you're one of those "oh he/she plays with girls/boys toys, they must be trans!" people. That is no less bigoted than the traditionalists. And yes, progressives can be bigots, and actually are more so on most subjects.

body:
Did you just ASSUME MY GENDER???!!!!!! REEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!!!!!!!!!!!

On a serious note, it's not nearly as much as throwing tantrums about it, making up pronouns and getting triggered when people can't keep track of them all, and constantly obsessing about your snowflake gender. Animals are not genders, and they have the same male and female genders themselves. Objects do not have genders as they aren't conscious. Concepts do not have genders. If you relate to these you relate to them separately, but they are separate from your gender.
